name: FilePicker
classdesc:
JET File Picker

Description:

By default the file picker shows a clickable dropzone for selecting files for upload. However, it can be replaced with any clickable element like a button. After the files are selected, the FilePicker fires a "select" event with the selected files. Application has to specify the listener in order to do the actual upload. The types of files accepted are controlled by the accept attribute. Additional custom validation can be done through the ojBeforeSelect event.

<oj-c-file-picker ></oj-c-file-picker>

Accessibility

Disabled content: JET supports an accessible luminosity contrast ratio, as specified in WCAG 2.0 - Section 1.4.3 "Contrast", in the themes that are accessible. (See the "Theming" chapter of the JET Developer Guide for more information on which themes are accessible.) Note that Section 1.4.3 says that text or images of text that are part of an inactive user interface component have no contrast requirement. Because disabled content may not meet the minimum contrast ratio required of enabled content, it cannot be used to convey meaningful information.

Touch End User Information

Target Gesture Action
Clickable element Tap Launch the browser's file picker.

Keyboard End User Information

Target Key Action
Clickable element Enter Launch the browser's file picker.

name: accept
description:
An array of strings of allowed MIME types or file extensions that can be uploaded; this is unlike the accept attribute of the html <input> element that accepts a simple comma-delimited string. If not specified, accept all file types.

Note: If accept is specified, files with empty string type will be rejected if no match found in the "accept" value. Due to browser/OS differences, you may have to specify multiple values for the same value type. For example, for a CSV file, you might need to specify 'text/csv', '.csv', 'application/vnd.ms-excel', 'text/comma-separated-values' and others depending on your target browser/OS.

name: capture
description: Specifies the preferred facing mode for the device's media capture mechanism; This is most often used to provide direct camera access on mobile devices. Note that the accept attribute must be specified and have an associated capture control type (e.g.["image/*"]) for the capture attribute to take effect. Support may vary by browser.

ojvalues.name: user
ojvalues.description: Specifies user-facing as the preferred mode

ojvalues.name: environment
ojvalues.description: Specifies environment-facing as the preferred mode

ojvalues.name: implementation
ojvalues.description: Specifies an implementation-specific default as the preferred facing mode

name: disabled
description: Disables the filepicker if set to true.

name: primaryText
description: The primary text for the default file picker.  It is either a string or a formatting function that returns the string to be displayed.

name: secondaryText
description:
The secondary text for the default file picker.  It is either a string or a formatting function that returns the string to be displayed.
The formatting function takes in a property object that contains the selection mode of the filepicker.

name: selectionMode
description: Whether to allow single or multiple file selection.

name: focus
description: Sets focus on the file picker or the first tabbable element for a file picker with custom content.

name: setProperty
description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

name: getProperty
description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

name: setProperties
description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

name: ojBeforeSelect
description: Triggered before files are selected to allow for custom validation.  To reject the selected files, the application can either call event.preventDefault() or pass a rejected Promise to the accept detail property. The latter approach is recommended because this allows the application to send a message stating why the files were rejected.

properties.name: accept
properties.description: This method can be called with an application-created Promise to cancel this event asynchronously.  The Promise should be resolved or rejected to accept or cancel the event, respectively.

name: ojInvalidSelect
description:
Triggered when invalid files are selected.  This event provides the application with a list of messages that should be displayed to give the user feedback about the
problems with their selection.  This feedback can be safely cleared when a subsequent ojBeforeSelect, ojInvalidSelect, or ojSelect event is received.  Additionally the
event.detail.until property may be populated with a Promise to provide short-term feedback during a user interaction (typically drag and drop); the feedback should be cleared upon resolution
of this Promise.

properties.name: messages
properties.description: Messages that should be displayed to the user describing invalid files.

properties.name: until
properties.description: This property may be populated with a Promise to provide short-term feedback during a user interaction (typically drag and drop); the feedback should be cleared upon the resolution of this Promise.

name: ojSelect
description: Triggered after the files are selected

properties.name: files
properties.description: The files that were just selected.

name: trigger
description: The trigger slot is used to replace the default content of the file picker. File picker will add click and drag and drop listeners to the slot content. The application is responsible for setting the tabindex attribute for keyboard accessibility.

name: touchDoc
description:
Target Gesture Action
Clickable element Tap Launch the browser's file picker.

name: keyboardDoc
description:
Target Key Action
Clickable element Enter Launch the browser's file picker.

name: ComponentMessageItem
description: A type for a single component message
